title: How to Roast Butternut Squash

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 230ºC/450ºF.
Clean the outside of the butternut squash.
steps.description: Wipe down and scrape off any dirt that needs removing. You'll be roasting with the peel on, so it needs to be clean.

steps.headline: Cut the butternut squash in halves.
steps.description: Scoop out the seeds and discard.

steps.headline: Prepare the butternut squash cubes.
steps.description: Cut each half into cubes (or near enough shapes) about 2cm/1 inch in thickness.

steps.headline: Brush the wedges with olive oil.
steps.description: Place in the roasting dish, skin side facing down. Sprinkle the cubes with a seasoning of choice (dried herbs, paprika, spicy mix, etc. ).

steps.headline: Place in the oven.
steps.description: Bake for 15 minutes.

steps.headline: Remove from the oven.
steps.description: Sprinkle with sea salt flakes. Turn the pieces over, then return to the oven.

steps.headline: Bake for a further 15 minutes, or until tender.
steps.description: Tenderness can be tested by sticking the point of a knife or a fork into the pieces; if it gives easily, the cubes are ready to serve.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Serve with a plate of other vegetables and meat, fish or a nut roast.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 180ºC/350ºF.
Clean the outside of the butternut squash.
steps.description: Wipe down and scrape off any dirt that needs removing. You'll be roasting with the peel on, so it needs to be clean.

steps.headline: Cut the butternut squash in halves.
steps.description: Scoop out the seeds and discard. You'll see a neat little hole emerge in each half once the seeds and seed webbing have been scraped out.

steps.headline: Place each half into the roasting dish, skin facing down.
Drizzle with olive oil.
steps.description: Add dabs of butter evenly across each half.

steps.headline: Season, to taste.
steps.description: Sprinkle salt and freshly black pepper across each half. Toss the thyme sprigs here and there on the halves.

steps.headline: Place in the oven.
steps.description: Roast for 45-50 minutes, or until the squash feels tender to the knife point or a fork. At least some parts of the squash should appear golden brown in coloring.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Carve the halves as wished. This dish looks nice if left whole when taken to the table, with a knife provided to encourage diners to carve off their own pieces.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 190ºC/375ºF.
Clean the outside of the butternut squash.
steps.description: Wipe down and scrape off any dirt that needs removing. You'll be roasting with the peel on, so it needs to be clean.

steps.headline: Cut the butternut squash in halves.
steps.description: Scoop out the seeds and discard.

steps.headline: Cut the butternut squash into wedges.
steps.description: Don't make them too thick.

steps.headline: Place the wedges into the roasting dish.
steps.description: Keep the skin facing down.

steps.headline: Drizzle the squash pieces with olive oil.
steps.description: Then pour the maple syrup over the wedges, making sure to cover all of them.

steps.headline: Add salt and pepper to taste.
steps.description: Sprinkle the cumin powder over. Finally, add the unpeeled garlic cloves here and there.

steps.headline: Place in the oven.
steps.description: Roast for 40 minutes, or until the squash feels tender to the knife point or a fork.

steps.headline: Serve hot.
steps.description: Serve with the roasted garlic cloves and drizzle any of the oily sauce that is in the pan over the wedges.

tyn: Drizzle nozzle for oil (optional but helpful)
text: Roasted butternut squash cubes Preheat the oven to 230ºC/450ºF.  Clean the outside of the butternut squash. Wipe down and scrape off any dirt that needs removing. You'll be roasting with the peel on, so it needs to be clean. Cut the butternut squash in halves. Scoop out the seeds and discard. Prepare the butternut squash cubes. Cut each half into cubes (or near enough shapes) about 2cm/1 inch in thickness. Brush the wedges with olive oil. Place in the roasting dish, skin side facing down. Sprinkle the cubes with a seasoning of choice (dried herbs, paprika, spicy mix, etc. ). Place in the oven. Bake for 15 minutes. Remove from the oven. Sprinkle with sea salt flakes. Turn the pieces over, then return to the oven. Bake for a further 15 minutes, or until tender. Tenderness can be tested by sticking the point of a knife or a fork into the pieces; if it gives easily, the cubes are ready to serve. Serve. Serve with a plate of other vegetables and meat, fish or a nut roast. Roasted butternut squash halves Preheat the oven to 180ºC/350ºF.  Clean the outside of the butternut squash. Wipe down and scrape off any dirt that needs removing. You'll be roasting with the peel on, so it needs to be clean. Cut the butternut squash in halves. Scoop out the seeds and discard. You'll see a neat little hole emerge in each half once the seeds and seed webbing have been scraped out. Place each half into the roasting dish, skin facing down.  Drizzle with olive oil. Add dabs of butter evenly across each half. Season, to taste. Sprinkle salt and freshly black pepper across each half. Toss the thyme sprigs here and there on the halves. Place in the oven. Roast for 45-50 minutes, or until the squash feels tender to the knife point or a fork. At least some parts of the squash should appear golden brown in coloring. Serve. Carve the halves as wished. This dish looks nice if left whole when taken to the table, with a knife provided to encourage diners to carve off their own pieces. Maple syrup roasted butternut squash Preheat the oven to 190ºC/375ºF.  Clean the outside of the butternut squash. Wipe down and scrape off any dirt that needs removing. You'll be roasting with the peel on, so it needs to be clean. Cut the butternut squash in halves. Scoop out the seeds and discard. Cut the butternut squash into wedges. Don't make them too thick. Place the wedges into the roasting dish. Keep the skin facing down. Drizzle the squash pieces with olive oil. Then pour the maple syrup over the wedges, making sure to cover all of them. Add salt and pepper to taste. Sprinkle the cumin powder over. Finally, add the unpeeled garlic cloves here and there. Place in the oven. Roast for 40 minutes, or until the squash feels tender to the knife point or a fork. Serve hot. Serve with the roasted garlic cloves and drizzle any of the oily sauce that is in the pan over the wedges.
sentences: Roasted butternut squash cubes Preheat the oven to 230ºC/450ºF.
Clean the outside of the butternut squash.
Wipe down and scrape off any dirt that needs removing.
You'll be roasting with the peel on, so it needs to be clean.
Cut the butternut squash in halves.
Scoop out the seeds and discard.
Prepare the butternut squash cubes.
Cut each half into cubes (or near enough shapes) about 2cm/1 inch in thickness.
Brush the wedges with olive oil.
Place in the roasting dish, skin side facing down.
Sprinkle the cubes with a seasoning of choice (dried herbs, paprika, spicy mix, etc.
Place in the oven.
Bake for 15 minutes.
Remove from the oven.
Sprinkle with sea salt flakes.
Turn the pieces over, then return to the oven.
Bake for a further 15 minutes, or until tender.
Tenderness can be tested by sticking the point of a knife or a fork into the pieces; if it gives easily, the cubes are ready to serve.
Serve.
Serve with a plate of other vegetables and meat, fish or a nut roast.
Roasted butternut squash halves Preheat the oven to 180ºC/350ºF.
Clean the outside of the butternut squash.
Wipe down and scrape off any dirt that needs removing.
You'll be roasting with the peel on, so it needs to be clean.
Cut the butternut squash in halves.
Scoop out the seeds and discard.
You'll see a neat little hole emerge in each half once the seeds and seed webbing have been scraped out.
Place each half into the roasting dish, skin facing down.
Drizzle with olive oil.
Add dabs of butter evenly across each half.
Season, to taste.
Sprinkle salt and freshly black pepper across each half.
Toss the thyme sprigs here and there on the halves.
Place in the oven.
Roast for 45-50 minutes, or until the squash feels tender to the knife point or a fork.
At least some parts of the squash should appear golden brown in coloring.
Serve.
Carve the halves as wished.
This dish looks nice if left whole when taken to the table, with a knife provided to encourage diners to carve off their own pieces.
Maple syrup roasted butternut squash Preheat the oven to 190ºC/375ºF.
Clean the outside of the butternut squash.
Wipe down and scrape off any dirt that needs removing.
You'll be roasting with the peel on, so it needs to be clean.
Cut the butternut squash in halves.
Scoop out the seeds and discard.
Cut the butternut squash into wedges.
Don't make them too thick.
Place the wedges into the roasting dish.
Keep the skin facing down.
Drizzle the squash pieces with olive oil.
Then pour the maple syrup over the wedges, making sure to cover all of them.
Add salt and pepper to taste.
Sprinkle the cumin powder over.
Finally, add the unpeeled garlic cloves here and there.
Place in the oven.
Roast for 40 minutes, or until the squash feels tender to the knife point or a fork.
Serve hot.
Serve with the roasted garlic cloves and drizzle any of the oily sauce that is in the pan over the wedges.
